definition: nun or sister (of the Roman Catholic or Greek Orthodox churches)
dried meat/private teacher's remuneration/withered/variant of 修[xiu1]
to decorate/to embellish/to repair/to build/to write/to cultivate/to study/to take (a class)

sentences.english: The nuns live in a cloister of calm.
sentences.chinese: 修女们住在一个幽静的修道院里。

sentences.english: The night before Naida’s twenty-first birthday, the ward sister called her into the office.
sentences.chinese: 奈妲21岁生日前一晚，舍监修女把她叫进办公室。

sentences.english: He mutilated the nun and stuffed into a closet.
sentences.chinese: 他杀了一名修女，他碎尸然后把尸体赛进柜子。

sentences.english: A cabbie picks up a nun.
sentences.chinese: 一位修女上了一辆出租车。

sentences.english: However, when the revellers saw the nun, the room went dead silent.
sentences.chinese: 那些人见到修女进来，整个场所登时变得死寂。

sentences.english: Sister Mary nodded and winked back.
sentences.chinese: 玛丽修女也点点头挤了挤眼睛。

sentences.english: "Who is it?" asks one of the nuns through the door.
sentences.chinese: “谁呀？”其中一个修女隔着门问。

sentences.english: Poor Clare Nuns attempted to repair this damage with patches.
sentences.chinese: 可怜的克莱尔修会修女尝试去修复这个肖像。

sentences.english: Well done, Sister Mary switched over the babies all by herself.
sentences.chinese: 干得好，玛丽修女自己一个人就把婴儿掉包了。

sentences.english: He'd never say that to Sister Carlotta, because it would only worry her.
sentences.chinese: 他不会告诉卡萝塔修女这些，那只会让她担忧。

sentences.english: A nun approaches: “Welcome, welcome, please feel free.”
sentences.chinese: 一位修女走过来对我说，“欢迎，欢迎，请自便。”

sentences.english: You have to give me the explaination you release Abel Nightroad, Sister. Aldgate.
sentences.chinese: 阿尔盖特修女，你需要给我放走亚伯的原因。

sentences.english: The nun was the odalisque, the priest was the eunuch.
sentences.chinese: 修女是宫嫔，神甫是太监。

sentences.english: Then one nun took the glass back to the kitchen.
sentences.chinese: 这时一个修女拿着杯子去了厨房。

sentences.english: In Christianity for example, nuns cannot show up without their hijab.
sentences.chinese: 就拿基督教来说吧，修女不能摘去她们的“盖头”。

definition: Jeanne d'Arc (1412-1431), French heroine and liberator, executed as a witch by the Burgundians and English/also called Jehanne Darc, the Maid or Orleans, Joan of Arc or St Joan
